\begin{figure}[!ht]
	\centering
	\begin{subfigure}[b]{0.49\textwidth}
		% https://q.uiver.app/#
		\[\begin{tikzcd}[cramped, column sep=scriptsize]
				\bullet && \bullet && \bullet \\
				\\
				\bullet && \bullet && \bullet \\
				\\
				\bullet && \bullet && \bullet
				\arrow["a", from=1-1, to=1-3]
				\arrow["c"', from=1-1, to=3-1]
				\arrow["b", from=1-3, to=1-5]
				\arrow["c"', from=1-3, to=3-3]
				\arrow["c"', from=1-5, to=3-5]
				\arrow["a", from=3-1, to=3-3]
				\arrow["d"', from=3-1, to=5-1]
				\arrow["e"{description}, from=3-1, to=5-3]
				\arrow["b"{description}, from=3-3, to=3-5]
				\arrow["d"', from=3-3, to=5-3]
				\arrow["d"', from=3-5, to=5-5]
				\arrow["a"', from=5-1, to=5-3]
				\arrow["b"{description}, from=5-3, to=5-5]
			\end{tikzcd}\]
		\caption{Communication and Left Merges}
	\end{subfigure}
	\begin{subfigure}[b]{0.49\textwidth}
		% https://q.uiver.app/#
		\[\begin{tikzcd}[cramped, column sep=scriptsize]
				\bullet && \bullet && \bullet \\
				\\
				\bullet && \bullet && \bullet \\
				\\
				\bullet && \bullet && \bullet
				\arrow["a", color={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, dashed, from=1-1, to=1-3]
				\arrow["c"', from=1-1, to=3-1]
				\arrow["b", from=1-3, to=1-5]
				\arrow["c"', from=1-3, to=3-3]
				\arrow["c"', from=1-5, to=3-5]
				\arrow["a", color={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, dashed, from=3-1, to=3-3]
				\arrow["d"', color={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, dashed, from=3-1, to=5-1]
				\arrow["e"{description}, from=3-1, to=5-3]
				\arrow["b"{description}, from=3-3, to=3-5]
				\arrow["d"', color={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, dashed, from=3-3, to=5-3]
				\arrow["d"', color={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, dashed, from=3-5, to=5-5]
				\arrow["a"', color={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, dashed, from=5-1, to=5-3]
				\arrow["b"{description}, from=5-3, to=5-5]
			\end{tikzcd}\]
		\caption{Restriction applied over the set $\{a, d\}$}
	\end{subfigure}
	\caption{Example of Communication on the process: $\partial_{\{a,d\}}(a.b \merge c.d)$. An example of how this can be modelled is a vending machine, take the function $a.b$ to mean \texttt{recieve payment}.\texttt{dispense item}, the function $c.d$ to mean \texttt{choose item}.\texttt{insert payment}, and the communication $a \mid d = e$ to mean \texttt{pay}. The process will then evaluate to the process \texttt{choose item.pay.dispense item}, with the process synchronising over \texttt{insert payment} and \texttt{recieve payment}.}
	\label{fig:communication}
\end{figure}
